title: Randi Bolt
text: With a relentless passion for exploring diverse topics and a commitment to continual improvement, I bring a dynamic data-driven approach to a diverse set of industries in the technical space. Explore my hands-on projects to witness firsthand my expertise, delve into insightful content on my various blogs, or connect with me through any of the provided links. I eagerly await the opportunity to engage with you in the near future.

title: Book Review: Carmageddon
text: In his thought-provoking book, Carmageddon: How Cars Make Life Worse and What to Do About It, Daniel Knowles challenges the unquestioned dominance of automobiles in modern society. With incisive analysis and compelling arguments, Knowles delves into the myriad ways in which car culture negatively impacts our lives and attempts to offer potential solutions for a more sustainable future.

title: 2024 January Winter Storm
text: In January 2024, Oregon was battered by a formidable storm, leaving a lasting imprint on our community. Months later, the scars of destruction still linger in our neighborhood, evident in the tarps draped over homes awaiting repair from the trees that crashed through them.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Friday Jan.Â 12th

Winter storm watch for the weekend for cold weather and snow.
No snow had not fallen, but we rescheduled Tanners family birthday dinner plans just to be safe.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Saturday Jan.Â 13th

Saturday seemed cold, but okay early in the day but winds kicked up in the afternoon.
We lost power around three, and ended up going to the Lariatt.
No update from PGE.
Slept in bed with Lulu with all the blankets on the bed.
It was very cold we could see breath.
We kept covering Lulu with a blanket.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Sunday Jan.Â 14th

Still no update from PGE.
Spend most of the day a the lariat.
House was cold when we returned.
Lulu was not eating a lot, probably because of how cold it was to stand by her food bowl.
We took apart the old bed frame and put it into the fire.
We closed all the doors inside the house, and brought the blankets and other supplies out to the living room.
We used the divider to close off living room to trap in heat.
We put towels under door.
Fire went out after midnight, but it still felt warmer than the bedroom.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Monday Jan.Â 15th

MLK Day and another storm is going to pass through on Tuesday.
We decide to pack up and go to Tanners moms house.
We drug lulu cow, and put her on my lap in the front passenger seat.
We stayed in lower level of tanners mom house.
On the drive is the first update from PGE since our power has gone out saying it will be back Tues. at 10 pm (which is also when the ice storm is suppose to end).
One of our neighbors roofs was completely smashed by a tree in the neighborhood.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Tuesday Jan.Â 16th

Tanners Birthday, but we did not get a cake ðŸ˜¢
Roads seem very icy, and we do not trust that power will be back on by 10pm.
We do get a text around midnight that the power has gone back on.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Wednesday Jan.Â 17th

Roads are icy, but we are eager to return home.
We give lulu drugs, but less this time.
Wait until afternoon and drive home.
When we get home the sink and bathroom facet were on, and the bathroom had flooded. We think it is the shower tub which flooded.
We only had power for a couple hours before losing it again.
The house was had warmed up, and everything was still in the living room. We decided to stay home.
PGE notifies that power will be returned to us at 10PM tomorrow night.
Something was off with the washing machine.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Thursday Jan.Â 18th

Tanner drives to multiple locations in the ice to get firewood. Ended up finding some at Lowes.
Power was out all day, and did not return until about 7 or 8 pm. It flickered a little bit throughout the night but never went back off.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Friday Jan.Â 19th

Power was back on for most of the day.
Went out twice. First time in later afternoon for ~ 1 hour, and then again in the evening for ~20 minutes.
Roads were very icy and un-drivable.

title: 2024 MLK Storm
text:
Saturday - Sunday

Power stayed on, but roads and sidewalks were still icy.

title: 2024 January Winter Storm
text:
Timeline
Friday Jan.Â 12th

Winter storm watch for the weekend for cold weather and snow.
No snow had not fallen, but we rescheduled Tanners family birthday dinner plans just to be safe.

Saturday Jan.Â 13th

Saturday seemed cold, but okay early in the day but winds kicked up in the afternoon.
We lost power around three, and ended up going to the Lariatt.
No update from PGE.
Slept in bed with Lulu with all the blankets on the bed.
It was very cold we could see breath.
We kept covering Lulu with a blanket.

Sunday Jan.Â 14th

Still no update from PGE.
Spend most of the day a the lariat.
House was cold when we returned.
Lulu was not eating a lot, probably because of how cold it was to stand by her food bowl.
We took apart the old bed frame and put it into the fire.
We closed all the doors inside the house, and brought the blankets and other supplies out to the living room.
We used the divider to close off living room to trap in heat.
We put towels under door.
Fire went out after midnight, but it still felt warmer than the bedroom.

Monday Jan.Â 15th

MLK Day and another storm is going to pass through on Tuesday.
We decide to pack up and go to Tanners moms house.
We drug lulu cow, and put her on my lap in the front passenger seat.
We stayed in lower level of tanners mom house.
On the drive is the first update from PGE since our power has gone out saying it will be back Tues. at 10 pm (which is also when the ice storm is suppose to end).
One of our neighbors roofs was completely smashed by a tree in the neighborhood.

Tuesday Jan.Â 16th

Tanners Birthday, but we did not get a cake ðŸ˜¢
Roads seem very icy, and we do not trust that power will be back on by 10pm.
We do get a text around midnight that the power has gone back on.

Wednesday Jan.Â 17th

Roads are icy, but we are eager to return home.
We give lulu drugs, but less this time.
Wait until afternoon and drive home.
When we get home the sink and bathroom facet were on, and the bathroom had flooded. We think it is the shower tub which flooded.
We only had power for a couple hours before losing it again.
The house was had warmed up, and everything was still in the living room. We decided to stay home.
PGE notifies that power will be returned to us at 10PM tomorrow night.
Something was off with the washing machine.

Thursday Jan.Â 18th

Tanner drives to multiple locations in the ice to get firewood. Ended up finding some at Lowes.
Power was out all day, and did not return until about 7 or 8 pm. It flickered a little bit throughout the night but never went back off.

Friday Jan.Â 19th

Power was back on for most of the day.
Went out twice. First time in later afternoon for ~ 1 hour, and then again in the evening for ~20 minutes.
Roads were very icy and un-drivable.

Saturday - Sunday

Power stayed on, but roads and sidewalks were still icy.

title: 2024 January Winter Storm
text:
Timeline of Events
Friday, Jan.Â 12th
A winter storm watch for the weekend warned of cold weather and snow. Despite no snowfall, we erred on the side of caution, rescheduling plans for my partner Tannerâ€™s family birthday dinner.
Saturday Jan.Â 13th
The day started calmly but turned tumultuous as winds picked up in the afternoon, leading to a power outage by 3 PM. Seeking refuge at our local watering hole, we waited for an update from PGE that wouldnâ€™t come for a few days. Enduring the biting cold again, we walked home, and huddled under blankets with our beloved cat, Lulu (as seen in the picture above).
Sunday Jan.Â 14th
With no updates from the power company, our day was spent navigating the cold reality of a powerless home. Concern for Luluâ€™s well-being prompted makeshift measures to retain heat, including burning old furniture and fortifying our living room against the chill. The fire went out after midnight, but the room still retained heat more than the other rooms in the house.
Monday Jan.Â 15th
As another storm loomed on the horizon, we made the decision to seek shelter at Tannerâ€™s momâ€™s house, braving treacherous roads with our faithful companion, Lulu. The drive marked the first communication from the power company for power to return 10PM Tuesday.
Tuesday Jan.Â 16th
Despite the icy roads and uncertainty, we received a belated message of restored power at midnight. A modest birthday gift for Tanner amidst the challenges.
Wednesday Jan.Â 17th
Eager to return home, we cautiously navigated icy roads, only to be greeted by the aftermath of a flooded bathroom upon arrival. Despite intermittent power, we resolved to stay put, improvising with limited resources. PGE says power should be back on tomorrow night at 10PM.
Thursday Jan.Â 18th
Tanner ventured out in search of firewood checking multiple locations, only to find some at Lowes. Power was out all day, and did not return until 8pm.
Friday Jan.Â 19th
Power was on for most of the day, but went out twice in the later afternoon. Roads are icy, and un-drivable.
Saturday - Sunday
Power stayed on, but roads and sidewalks were still icy.

title: 2024 January Winter Storm
text:
Prepared Checklist

Turn off water lines.
Check travel chargers are fully charged.
Essential electronics are fully charged.
Spare batteries.
Spare candles.
Remove water from glass.
Prepare overnight bag for quick exits.

title: 2024 January Winter Storm
text:
Bonus Items

Costco generator.
Batteries for headlamps.
Spare firewood.

title: Educational Insights
text:
Notes from Ge Shaoâ€™s Applied Regression Analysis Fall 2021 class. Topics include simple linear regression, least-square estimates, hypothesis testing, t-stat, p-stat, sum of squares estimates, mean square error, confidence interval, R squared, multiple linear models, hat matrix, multilinearity, model adequacy checking, residual analysis, PRESS statistic, detecting outliers, correcting model inadequacies, stabilizing variance, DIFFTS, DFBETAS, COVRATIO,â€¦ Continue reading.



Notes from Nadee Jayasenaâ€™s Introduction ot Mathematical Statistics II Winter 2022 class. Topics include marginal PDFâ€™s, joint PDFâ€™s and CDFâ€™s, independence of random variables, bivariate probability, conditional distribution, conditional covariance, correlation, univariate transformations, bivariate transformations, Jacobians, method of moment-generating functions, sampling distributions, central limit theorem, â€¦ Continue reading



Notes from Dorcas Ofori-Boatenâ€™s Introduction to Mathematical Statistics I Fall 2021 class. Topics include mean, median, mode, variance, standard deviation, Empirical Rule, set theory, DeMorgans Law, Distributive Law, counting rules, statistical independence, mutual independence, total law of probability, Bayes Rule, discrete and continuous random variables, probability distribution, expected value, CDF, PMF, PDF, â€¦ Continue reading



Notes from Subash Kocharâ€™s Applied Statistics for Engineers and Scientists Summer 2021 class. Topics include discrete and continous random various, bernoulli random variables, pmf, pdf, expeced value, variance, mean, standard deviation, probablity distributions: Poisson, binomial, uniform, normal, exponential, gamma, chi-squared, Weibull, lognormal, â€¦Continue reading

Topics include set theory, cancellation law, subgroups, cyclic subgroups, injecteive, surjective, bijective, function composition, permutation groups, symmetric groups, dihedral group, cycle decomposition, parity of transposistions, alternating groups, isomorphism, partitions, Lagrangeâ€™s Theorem, homomorphism, normal subgroups, kernal, â€¦ Continue reading

title: Dashboards
text: This shiny app presents the results of a survey where participants predicted the winners of various Oscars categories.

title: Dashboards
text:
Covid-19
Covid Dashboard is an interactive analysis tool that specifically examines Covid-19 cases and fatalities in both the United States and my home state of Oregon. What initially began as a class project at the onset of the pandemic, has undergone multiple iterations and refinements to evolve into a fully functional and informative dashboard. Continue reading
